00001 
00002 /*! \file  oct_req.h
00003     \brief Host test app: Header file for linux user-space request/response
00004                           test application.
00005 */
00006 
00007 
00008 /* Refer to the html documentation about restriction on input and
00009    output sizes for user-space requests.
00010 */
00011 
00012 
00013 /* The octeon device on which requests must be sent. */
00014 #define OCTEON_ID    0
00015 
00016 #define REQ_IQ_NO    0
00017 
00018 #define TEST_THREAD_COUNT  1
00019 
00020 
00021 /* Enable this definition to add signature data to input buffers which gets
00022    verified from the output buffers on response. The core application is
00023    responsible for copying the input buffer contents to the output buffers.
00024 */
00025 #define VERIFY_DATA 1
00026 
00027 
00028 /* Turn on this flag to generate diff input/output buf sizes when MAX_INBUFS
00029  * and MAX_OUTBUFS > 1 */
00030 //#define RANDOMIZE   
00031 
00032 
00033 /* Maximum number of input and output buffers. The actual number used for
00034    a request is a random selection in the range (1, MAX_USERBUFS). This
00035    value should be in the range (1 <= MAX_USERBUFS <= MAX_BUFCNT).
00036    MAX_BUFCNT is defined in driver/host/include/cavium_defs.h.
00037    Also when using SCATTER dma mode the max output buffers cannot exceed 13.
00038 */
00039 #define MAX_INBUFS 1
00040 #define MAX_OUTBUFS 1
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 /* Size of each input buffer. Choose values such that maximum input size
00045    (MAX_INBUFS * INBUF_SIZE) does not exceed maximum bytes defined for
00046    each dma mode. See include/cavium_defs.h for max data values.
00047 */
00048 #define INBUF_SIZE    (1 * 1024)
00049 
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 /* Size of each output buffer. Choose values such that maximum output size
00054    (MAX_OUTBUFS * OUTBUF_SIZE) does not exceed maximum bytes defined for
00055    each dma mode. See include/cavium_defs.h for max data values.
00056    The minimum valid size is 16 bytes. The maximum supported value is 
00057    (122744) for scatter. See driver documentation for more details.
00058 */
00059 #define OUTBUF_SIZE    (1 * 1024)
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063 #define REQUEST_TIMEOUT   500
00064 
00065 
00066 #define MAX_NB_REQUESTS   256
00067 
00068 
00069 
00070 /* DMA mode to use for requests. Pick one of
00071    OCTEON_DMA_DIRECT; OCTEON_DMA_GATHER; OCTEON_DMA_SCATTER; 
00072    OCTEON_DMA_SCATTER_GATHER.
00073 
00074    Default is OCTEON_DMA_DIRECT.
00075 */
00076 OCTEON_DMA_MODE        TEST_DMA_MODE  =   OCTEON_DMA_DIRECT;
00077 
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081 /* Response order to use for requests. Pick one of
00082    OCTEON_RESP_NORESPONSE; OCTEON_RESP_ORDERED; OCTEON_RESP_UNORDERED;
00083 
00084    Note: ORDERED mode is not supported for user-space requests. This 
00085          mode is useful only as a negative test for the driver.
00086 
00087    Default is OCTEON_RESP_NORESPONSE.
00088 */
00089 OCTEON_RESPONSE_ORDER   TEST_RESP_ORDER  =  OCTEON_RESP_NORESPONSE;
00090 
00091 
00092 
00093 
00094 /* Response mode to use for requests. Pick one of
00095    OCTEON_RESP_NON_BLOCKING; OCTEON_RESP_BLOCKING;
00096 
00097    Default is OCTEON_RESP_NON_BLOCKING.
00098 */
00099 OCTEON_RESPONSE_ORDER   TEST_RESP_MODE  =  OCTEON_RESP_NON_BLOCKING;
